name: Street Legal Racing: Redline v2.3.1
description: The most popular vehicle mechanic simulator in the world got a second life in the new Steam version! Build cars, tune them, crash, repair and race against other racers!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad 2GHz+ Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce 9800 DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 3000 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 Processor: Intel Core i7 2.6GHz, quad-core Memory: 2048 MB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX760 DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 3000 MB available space Additional Notes: SSD drive is higly recommended for the best performance

reviews.review_text: You will think this game is the worst game ever in the first 10 minutes. After 10 minutes this game will become your new addiction.Spent 2 hours building a 1800bhp Nissan GTR(Btw most mods work with this version of the game). 30 minutes of gameplay and the AI decides to ram me. I was sent into a pole, the engine flew out.   10/10 I would like to see the AI raging again.  EDIT: Check my screenshots to see how the game(+mods) look :).This game will regain popularity due to its steam release so expect mods for this version:)(100% compatible, some mods will crash your game due to older version). Also most mods are made in High Quality rather than game graphics :D.

It's as good as a heavily modified 13 year old cult classic game is going to be. Very glitchy, crashes more then you'd like, but I can't name a rice 'n race game with the sort of car building/modding experience as you get in the Street Legal series. Except maybe that failed Kickstarter for a successor by the same company. Ah well.  What I'm more interested in is if SLRR 2.3.1 will still be on the store in a week's time. I'm going to assume they have some sort of deal with Invictus if they're going to monetise a mod of their game, as old as it is. Even without that, this version's still a legal minefield. Music I wonder if they've got the rights to use. Many, many real brand logos (other then the ones included in the original game) throughout game pictures and usable by the player. Meme faces as decals (Important when the Trollface meme creator is able to get it's likeness pulled from PAYDAY 1 and 2). For some reason you can put the red Angry Bird on your car as a decal, I wouldn't know why you'd want to but you can. Real life circuits in the all-new Amateur events mode. Hell, the Flatout destruction derby arena was ripped to be used for the derby events. At least the 'base' game doesn't come with real cars, only the vague likenesses offered by both SL and SLRR.  It all seems to point to a group of talented modders who had no idea what they're getting into by slapping a price tag on a community mod and getting it up on the Steam store.

SO! Let's get right to the point. Yes, the game's old, and out dated, and fake cars, yada yada yada.  Sure it crashes, sure it's got bugs.  But all in all? I recommend it. You can't play Forza or Granturismo, and buy a chassis, chose your suspension parts, engine heads, pistons, turbos and super chargers, and build a car that you want.  Oh, and wreck it five seconds after you're done building it. Protip: Alt+F4 is your friend!  I've never played a racing game that lets you do what SLRR does, and I've been playing Racing games since Ridge Racer in 1993.

Good game! Good good game! Though, it sometimes makes me angry, when you just get out of your garage with the new used vehicle you got, and then someone crashes it, then you lose your engine and money. It's sometimes crashy, and it does not have mercy, when crashing cars, but it's perfect! Good! I reccomend it!

I totally recommend this game to anyone who loves customization in car games. Main problems include dumbass AI that always steer into you(atleast in my case), random crashes, sketchy driving physics, and rather steep learning curve if you don't know about cars. BUT, You start out with nothing and $20,000 to spend. Most cars you'll find will be rather crap, but if you drive right and spend right you'll end up with a beast of a machine. The paint booth deserves the most mention, though the decals are rather low res the paint aspect is really detailed. Overall I recommend this game if you really love modding cars. Especially for 8 bucks.
Hey, they even got Bosch, Coca Cola, K&N and other brands in this game!

I would definitely recomend. A lot less buggier and now they added the kits to catalog like veryone has been requesting meaning the devs are listening to the community. It also apears they are working on a workshop to make mod management a lot easier.

I bought this game on the 16th of November. Showing by the hours I've played this game a lot.  Apart From Being unstable (it crashes quite a bit when you have lots of cars or a large progression)  It also Has Cheat Codes. Something most games don't have anymore. 9/10 I would recommend

I had originally written a negative review for this, seeing as it crashed and froze about every 5 minutes. After enabling compability settings (running the game in admin mode and Windows XP mode), the game now crashes significantly less. It now crashes perhaps one time in an hour, and as such I deem it playable. It is also pretty fun.   Coming from someone who had never played SLRR before the Steam release, the amount of modifications you can make to the cars in this game is pretty intense. Nearly any car can become a beast with the right kind of tuning. You can tune anything down to the fuel mixture and camshaft angles, which is essentially as much tuning as anyone could really want in a casual game. The 'game' portion of the game is somewhat lacking, however. The controls are fairly arcadey, and the races are kind of grindy.  All in all, buy it if you like to tinker with engines and turbochargers and wings, for that, it is unsurpassed, perhaps beaten by Automation, however that game does not allow you to drive your creations. This game does, and while somewhat lackluster in regard to 'career' or whatever you want to call it, it is still fun!

Don't expect this game not to crash, but don't expect to not have fun because it does. This game may be old, but it's better then some of the games today imo. For sure try this out, it's worth the money.

Only one complaint...... THE AI WHEN YOU FINISH A DRAG RACE FIX THEM!!!! They turn dumb after they finish and slam into your car damaging your car and most of the time TOTALING IT ITS ANNOYING AND MADE ME RAGE QUIT!
Fantastic game with awesome customization. Really wish someone would make an updated version of this!!!

So, here's my review on Street Legal Racing: Redline v2.3.1. Be warned that this is only my subjective opinion. The product is a game with the advanced functionality of assembly / painting cars. Here, they tried their best, replace and paint can be every single detail. However, for the purchase of spare parts for our cars we need money that you can earn only in races in this very car. Take care of your car during the race, because the smaller the damage - the less money you spend on repairs. What sways the technical parameters of the game, the graphic does not look presentable for the Games in 2016, however, this oversight can be forgiven thanks to the tuning machines. The physics in the game at the level, but to the ideal is to go. What exactly does not disappoint because it is musical accompaniment. Frustrating lack of controller, with which one could play sitting on the couch, as well as trading cards and achievements. Price would like to have a little bit smaller.
could you add more money in the game please

PROS: *Great car customization (In-depth engine, suspension, & car body building) *Many different races to choose from, whether its track, drag, or street racing (or even demolition derby) *Good soft body physics *Decently sized city to roam around in  CONS: *Has a big problem of crashing alot  *Removed cheats. (I have no idea why the new devs removed the cheats. It was nice to be able to make a quick/cool build and go and race. They NEED to add the cheats back in ASAP!) *Ok-ish physics (I get that its an old game running on an old engine) *Outdated graphics (Again, I get that its an old game)
I Love this Game But I cant do Any races It just stops working for me It crushes on me any help?  Intel I7 Geforce GTX 960 windows 10 cant play for some reason help
This game is just incredible.I really enjoy spending about 30 mins to build a car and then crash it and act like it was an accident. Great game 11/10
this game need more offroad things

I loved this game, I remember getting this game bundled with a shirt when I was little. The game is definitely WORTH THE PRICE if you like customizing cars. If this game was polished a little more I would've been fine paying more. Just please ADD a LOAN SYSTEM so when I go rocketing into a wall and total my car I dont have to start a new game.

I like but so far in my 40mins of playing I have had 2 crashes :( one going to the garage and the other one just loading up a race. But other than that I love the game, the amount of custom parts and the tuning. You can make any car your own :) I would recommend
Thanks you dev for finally fixing the crash
Plays like 2.3.0 and is an upgrade from 2.2.1 mwm (which i was using)   Best part is steam overlay  9/10 would be 10/10 but it crashes
its a great game exept for it crashs alot

Ok,ok,ok . . . I know it crashes a lot! But let it be. It just came to the steam and it have soo much opportunities to become one of the best racing games (tbh i thought that this game was dead). Now that i see this game alive on Steam! Just imagine! WorkShop! Mods EVERYTHING on one place, no more going into directory modifying files, simple click voala you have it! Give it a bit time, and support devs before wanting refund! (All for all new commers)!     Sorry english is not my main :D

About 2-3 years ago i found SLR 2.3.0LE i was playing like a madman... 500 hours modding the game with cars content and everything.In this game you can doo everything you want,create a dragster,create a drift car,create a circuit car,every part is adjustable,the suspension,brake,tire pressure,bost presure,advance timming,everything you want,you only need imagination.I recommand this game to everyone ho is a petrolhead. (And don't get frustated when the engine pops out after a crash)
it's alright it crashes everytime i went into the city unlike the older version of the game but i reutrned it cause of problems with the maybe i'll buy when it's on sale
TL;DR at the end   General info

One of the best street racing games ever made!  Build up your car, cruise around, race some folks, run from the cops, smash your brand new car, rinse and repeat. I have spent countless hours on this game as a kid and it's STILL one of the best games I've ever played. Don't get me wrong...the physics kinda suck and the game itself is buggy as hell. But it's still an amazing simulation of what street racing is. Being able to build up the entire motor, suspension and body. Tuning specific parts to change how the car behaves. This game taught me what tires couldn't fit on my car, what spring rates and timing was. Mixtures of Gearhead Garage and NFS:U.  Do yourself a favor and pick up this game. I promise that if you are into cars in the slightest (building them), then this game is definitely for you! Now that it's on Steam, and the Workshop is coming, I think Street Legal Racing could make an epic comeback. Join us and help bring back this gem!
Greatest garage sim of all time.
Just a nice game to build and mess around in.
really good game and fun for people that love cars all around

this game is AWESOME (if you love cars, that is) i know alot about cars and i can say myself its realistic! but there are ALOT of bugs like when you take off the wheels of a car the car glitches off the platform and sometimes parts fall off like the sideskirt, luckily you can fix it by going on and off the market. aswell as the HUGE bug of random crashing for no reason even if you have a really good computer (like me) PLEASE developers fix this! i would probably play it ALOT more if it didnt crash or glitch! i would also LOVE to see some sandbox mode or some other gamemodes like wreckfest or something like that. i would also love some senarios. in conclusion i love this game but all it needs is some bug fixes and added gamemodes for me to reccomend it to everyone
Wooooa, back again, this is the top of the tuning games. Please devs keep going!!!
I really like the game if you could get the game to tip freezing on the day time races and when loading in to the city itd be fun but I'm plagued by these

I crashed my car and seconds later I crashed my game 10/10  But on a serious note, this game can be fun, but for me I gotta really try just to avoid issues with this game that could be fixed. You fear long loading screens because nine times out of ten they result in your game crashing. Text sometimes becomes too spaced out to all fit on one screen. Cars oversteer when they shouldnt and understeer when they need to act quick. AI will sometimes rear-end you at the end of a road race to no fault of your own, because at the end of a race it locks your brakes, disabling your ability to move.  These are just some of the many issues this game has. Easily the buggiest game I have ever seen. Don't get it until they fix some of these issues. Edit: I played this game more and still had the same issues and more. One main thing that ruins this for me is that I put probably 20 minutes into racing, and then a car rear-ends me at the end of a steet race and ruins my car, sinks me back down to 10k after I already had 25k and a 30k car.

It's a great game, real fun. But the balance in the drag races is awful, 1 minute you can pull a win against a pretty stylish high powered street car in a cheap beater, next minute you get slapped in the chops by a hatchback when you're in a ferrari with a V10... Drag racing balance is bad and so's the prizes you get from drag races, and as for race track races, could never get into them due to the overly harsh restrictions on cars.  Plus the overbundance of crashes, go into my garage happy that i just managed to peel off a victory that was close as hell, only to find out i got nothing from it because the game crapped it's pants and crashed. Whether it be mid race or going to the garage. Crashes alllll the time. And. The worst part...  Settings, never save... Turning autosave off, then all of a sudden, it saved when i didn't expect it when i bashed my car into a wall and lost it, which ended the career.   So... For now. I don't recommend this game. If it got more updates, more cars, crash fixes and BALANCE. Then i'd recommend. Sorry devs...  --------------------------------------- UPDATE --------------------------------------  An update deleted my save game where i actually made some progress and to top it off it was a 'stability' update which made the game a whole lot less stable. So. GG and seriously. Only buy this game if you got the patience of a monk and just love starting everything all over again. And again. And again...

Fun game but its plauged by bugs that really make it breaking. Files have to be re verified & reaquired(typically around 230 of them) constantly, game crashes, careers & cars don't get saved despite going to the menu and saving it myself. Currenty have 2 careers/ save files. Both of them useless. Don't think I can recommend until I can play knowing I won't have to keep starting over.

After I crached my car the game closed down so I opened it up again and the settings were messed up and so was the resoulution. When I went into the settings the game crashed and wouldn't open so I restarted my computer and it still won't open! I reccomend getting this game once therew have been many updates.

Can not recommend this game. Driving around is pretty fun, but in the career mode it is impossible to get anywhere unless you are extremely proficient in keyboard driving.   If you have any front end collision above a certain speed the engine will fly out, which you then have to piece together the entire engine and if you don't have enough money then well you have to start over again.   I gave it chance but I don't feel anyone with any doubts should.

this games just becoming more frustrating and hassle than its worth. if im honest until they fix all the crashing on loading screens, ESPECIALLY the crashing when you put in 'testme' cheat (dunno iif thats just me) and its just so buggy, crashy and not worth the money you pay for it (especially if its a present from one of your friends). needs sorting or im just gonna uninstall to stop frustration.
